intro: Zaluzania quitensis, commonly known as the Andean zigzag plant, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is known for its distinctive zigzagging stem and hairy leaves, which help it adapt to its high-altitude environment. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Zaluzania quitensis is often found in rocky or grassy slopes, thriving in cool, moist conditions.
